item.title: PopArt typeface puzzle
item.description: Rompecapezas alfabético presentado en treinta y seis piezas, con veintiséis letras y números del 0 al 9. La typografía PopArt Typeface® fue diseñada para maximizar el área de visibilidad dentro de su forma. © 2011 Manuel Olmo Rodríguez/olmocs
item.content:encoded: Rompecapezas alfabético presentado en treinta y seis piezas, con veintiséis letras y números del 0 al 9. La typografía PopArt Typeface® fue diseñada para maximizar el área de visibilidad dentro de su forma. © 2011 Manuel Olmo Rodríguez/olmocs

item.title: Brain Cruncher Game for Quaker Life Packaging
item.description: Rod Hunt recently worked with Hornall Anderson Design in Seattle to illustrate the Brain Cruncher game to appear on the back of Quaker Life & Cruchtime Cereal packaging. Five different versions of the illustration were created for the Original, Cinnamon, Strawberry, Apple Cinnamon & Maple Brown Sugar flavours.
item.content:encoded: Rod Hunt recently worked with Hornall Anderson Design in Seattle to illustrate the Brain Cruncher game to appear on the back of Quaker Life & Cruchtime Cereal packaging. Five different versions of the illustration were created for the Original, Cinnamon, Strawberry, Apple Cinnamon & Maple Brown Sugar flavours.

item.title: Dicibio
item.description: Dicibio is the simplest armchair that can be made in various types of materials for indoor or outdoor use. The shape and elasticity of used materials gives it structural support as well as ability to adopt to different users. With impact of user's weight, its armrests are spreading sidewards by changing the angle of the backrest but for better sitting comfort there is also pillow shaped as inverted cone that can be easily separated. Its simple form allows enormous possibilities for personalization with different combination of colors, patterns or stickers. Customization and wide range of materials also allows to fit any style of interior or exterior. Design: Darko Nikoli? Modeling: Darko Nikoli? Renderings: Darko Nikoli? Post-production and presentation: Darko Nikoli?
item.content:encoded: Dicibio is the simplest armchair that can be made in various types of materials for indoor or outdoor use. The shape and elasticity of used materials gives it structural support as well as ability to adopt to different users. With impact of user's weight, its armrests are spreading sidewards by changing the angle of the backrest but for better sitting comfort there is also pillow shaped as inverted cone that can be easily separated. Its simple form allows enormous possibilities for personalization with different combination of colors, patterns or stickers. Customization and wide range of materials also allows to fit any style of interior or exterior. Design: Darko Nikoli? Modeling: Darko Nikoli? Renderings: Darko Nikoli? Post-production and presentation: Darko Nikoli?

item.title: Andy Warhol $ Deeply Superficial
item.description: ANDY WARHOL 1960/1980 DEEPLY SUPERFICIAL ART EXHIBITION Bologna, Italy, 2012 Art Fair Event organized by Orea Malià and Rosini Gutman Gallery. In 1952 Andy Warhol had his first exhibition in Hugo Gallery, New York, how many others of those he had since then? The concept behind the design focuses on the fact that Warhol himself became a Pop figure. The meaning of Warhol's works and the American Pop Art, has been so well assimilated into our culture.  The media and art experts no longer focus on the meaning but rather on the results of auctions or art market indexes where Warhol is still leading. The poster and catalog design going with the flow and repeats the text and the famous photo by Greg Gorman. The Gold fifth color and element in the catalog design express all of the above. The gold silk paper that wraps the catalog sealed by vinyl stickers quotes few of Warhol's famous sayings. Thorough the endless exhibiting of his work, Warhol himself became a pop art beyond the one he created.
item.content:encoded: ANDY WARHOL 1960/1980 DEEPLY SUPERFICIAL ART EXHIBITION Bologna, Italy, 2012 Art Fair Event organized by Orea Malià and Rosini Gutman Gallery. In 1952 Andy Warhol had his first exhibition in Hugo Gallery, New York, how many others of those he had since then? The concept behind the design focuses on the fact that Warhol himself became a Pop figure. The meaning of Warhol's works and the American Pop Art, has been so well assimilated into our culture.  The media and art experts no longer focus on the meaning but rather on the results of auctions or art market indexes where Warhol is still leading. The poster and catalog design going with the flow and repeats the text and the famous photo by Greg Gorman. The Gold fifth color and element in the catalog design express all of the above. The gold silk paper that wraps the catalog sealed by vinyl stickers quotes few of Warhol's famous sayings. Thorough the endless exhibiting of his work, Warhol himself became a pop art beyond the one he created.

item.title: Coca Cola 125th Year Exhibition
item.description: For Coca-Colas 125th Anniversary Exhibition's Future Room concept, Antilop transformed santralistanbul's Galeri 1 into an immersive environment by creating 90 square meter of 270-degree projection system. Client:Coca Cola Agency: Boogy Location: santralistanbul Date: 07.12.2011 Duration: 4'30'' Creative Directors : Refik Anadol / Maurizio Braggiotti / Efe Mert Kaya / Art Direction/Visual Artist : Can Büyükberber Production Director : Serkan Arslan Sound Design: Kerim Karao?lu
item.content:encoded: For Coca-Colas 125th Anniversary Exhibition's Future Room concept, Antilop transformed santralistanbul's Galeri 1 into an immersive environment by creating 90 square meter of 270-degree projection system. Client:Coca Cola Agency: Boogy Location: santralistanbul Date: 07.12.2011 Duration: 4'30'' Creative Directors : Refik Anadol / Maurizio Braggiotti / Efe Mert Kaya / Art Direction/Visual Artist : Can Büyükberber Production Director : Serkan Arslan Sound Design: Kerim Karao?lu

item.title: Maru
item.description: Maru is a showroom and online boutique selling high-end Japanese design objects ranging from delicate porcelain to handmade stationery. Founded and curated by Japanese architect Motoko Yoshida, the Oslo based boutique has a clear aim of offering high quality Japanese goods to Scandinavians with a taste for good design. We were approached by Maru to design the boutique's identity, ranging from logotype, stationery, packaging and signage to the design and development of the online shop.
item.content:encoded: Maru is a showroom and online boutique selling high-end Japanese design objects ranging from delicate porcelain to handmade stationery. Founded and curated by Japanese architect Motoko Yoshida, the Oslo based boutique has a clear aim of offering high quality Japanese goods to Scandinavians with a taste for good design. We were approached by Maru to design the boutique's identity, ranging from logotype, stationery, packaging and signage to the design and development of the online shop.

item.title: Jennifer Behr Brand Book
item.description: Luxury hair accessory designer, Jennifer Behr, approached RoAndCo to design her 2011 brand book. The brand places a strong emphasis on handmade, high quality designs. We created a large canvas box that encases four books: one for each of her collections and an overview. Behind each book is a headpiece from the collections, to emphasize the hand made quality of attention to detail in every item.
item.content:encoded: Luxury hair accessory designer, Jennifer Behr, approached RoAndCo to design her 2011 brand book. The brand places a strong emphasis on handmade, high quality designs. We created a large canvas box that encases four books: one for each of her collections and an overview. Behind each book is a headpiece from the collections, to emphasize the hand made quality of attention to detail in every item.
